Dear Harry:
I have looked into the questions raised by the Oklahoma schools and by
the University of North Carolina concerning the preferential mailing
rates for sound recordings and for 16 mm film and film catalogs. Your
letters of September 18th to Mrs. Tucker of the Oklahoma schools and of
September 30th to the University of North Carolina are absolutely correct.
Sections 34.83 and 34*84 of the postal regulations are substantially
different, although both relate to fourth class postal rates. However,
there are two different postal rates provided for thereby. The book rat©
as provided for by Section 34.84 is 8 cents for the first pound or
fraction thereof plus 4 cents for each additional pound or fraction thereof.
In contrast, the library rat© is 4 cents for the first pound or fraction
thereof, and 1 cent for each additional pound or fraction thereof, but
applies only to parcels addressed for local delivery in the first, second,
or third zone, or within the State. Thus, the specificity of Section
34.84 applying the substantially higher book rate to 16 mm film and film
catalogs precludes its applicability to other types of recordings which
are provided for at the lower library rate of Section 34.83.
As you undoubtedly know, both of these provisions of the postal regula¬
tions affording a preferential postal rate for the mailing of films and
related material for educational use, stem from Public Law 141 which was
passed by the 83rd Congress on July 20, 1953. This Act amends Sections
204 (d) and (a) of the Postal Rate Revision and Federal Employees Salary
Act of 1948 which relates to Fourth-Class (Parcel Post) mail. The
legislation aid its history make clear that Section 1 thereof (now
Section 34.84 of the Postal Regulations) was designed to make mail rates
(the higher fourth class rate) then applicable to permanently bound books
containing no advertisjjjg matters also applicable to 16 mm films and
16 mm film catalogs when sent through the mails except when sent to
commercial theatres. Section 2 thereof (now Sectidn 34.83 of the Postal
